intro: Hedyotis mannii var. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender leaf bladdernut, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It features small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family.
